email:
Subject: Questions regarding Graduate Application to MSc Software Engineering at UCL

Dear Admissions Team,

I hope this email finds you well. My name is John Doe, and I am an international student who has recently received a conditional offer to the MSc in Software Engineering program at University College London (UCL). I am excited about the opportunity to study at UCL and am eager to clarify a few points regarding my application.

As an international student, I was wondering if it is necessary for me to provide a financial guarantee with my application. I understand that this information will be used to assess my ability to fund my studies in the UK. Could you please confirm whether this is required at this stage of the application process?

Regarding the status of my application, could you please inform me when I can expect to receive a final decision? I would like to plan accordingly and make necessary arrangements.

Additionally, if I have not yet accepted my offer by the deadline, what are the next steps that I should take? Should I contact your office directly to confirm my intention to accept the offer or wait for further instructions?

I appreciate your time and assistance with these queries. I look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Thank you for your help,

John Doe

questions.question: I'm an international student and have received a conditional offer, should I provide a financial guarantee with my application?
questions.answer:
If you are an international applicant who requires a Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS), a financial guarantee should be provided at the point you request your CAS.

The financial guarantee should state that either you or your sponsor is able to cover any outstanding fees and maintenance for the duration of your programme of study.

A financial guarantee should not be provided during the application stage.

questions.question: When will I receive a decision on my application?
questions.answer:
UCL aims to consider complete applications within six weeks of receiving them, however, this may take longer at busy times.

Research programmes have specific procedures and timescales for considering applications, so response times can vary.

In order to check the progress of your application please log in to your application portal.

questions.question: What should I do if I have not yet accepted my offer?
questions.answer:
If you have not yet accepted your offer, please do so as soon as possible through the Applicant Portal.

If you do not accept your offer by the deadline date stated in your offer letter, your offer will be withdrawn and you will not be able to take up your place.

UCL does not automatically acknowledge your acceptance of an offer. You will be able to view your acceptance in the Applicant Portal. Once you have accepted your offer, we will communicate with you directly via the Applicant Portal to confirm your next steps and to confirm when pre-enrolment opens.
